image.altText: An older woman and her daughter smiling in a close up photo

props.synopsis: Carers say a "broken sector" is letting down their loved ones with dementia, while a new study shows "confronting" diagnosis delays.

title.children: Some patients wait five years for diagnosis of 'Australia's biggest killer'

image.altText: A white plane wing with  red tip

props.synopsis: The closure of the three bases will take effect in 2026 and affect about 70 personnel, who will be supported throughout the process, the airline said.

title.children: Qantas to close staff bases in Canberra, Hobart and Mildura

image.altText: A close-up photo of a woman.

props.synopsis: After 36 years working as a house cleaner, Judy Harman needs a knee replacement, but there are hundreds of people in front of her on the wait list for orthopaedic surgery in Canberra.

title.children: Judy is crippled with pain as she waits for surgery in Canberra

image.altText: James Slipper looks to his right during a Wallabies Test.

props.synopsis: After 15 years of international rugby union, Wallabies veteran James Slipper announces he is drawing the curtain on his Test career.

title.children: Brumbies star Slipper to quit Test rugby

image.altText: The Big Merino is featured on the latest round of 'Big Things' coins and stamps.

props.synopsis: Towering over a service station at a well-known rest stop on the road between Canberra and Sydney, Goulburn's Big Merino is turning 40.

title.children: Big Merino featured in latest 'big things' coin and stamp series

image.altText: Del sticks her tongue out, pretending to be a cat and wearing her costume and sitting near the stage.

props.synopsis: By day, Canberra public servant Del Goncalves works in a typical office and wears typical office clothes, but come nightfall, she dons a bunny costume and trades her office for a wrestling ring.

title.children: Canberra car dealers and public servants by day, pro wrestlers by night

image.altText: A person at the beach reapplying sunscreen

props.synopsis: A total of 18 sunscreens have now been recalled or paused over inaccurate SPF protection claims, so we asked the experts what consumers should do now.

title.children: Find out if your sunscreen has been caught up in the recalls

image.altText: An umpire bounces a ball before an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The AFL will no longer have the traditional bouncedown to start men's games, and has also ditched the controversial sub rule.

title.children: After more than a century, the centre bounce is no more in the AFL

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks outdoors.

props.synopsis: China's state iron ore buyer has ordered steelmakers to pause purchases of iron ore shipments from BHP, according to media reports, as they continue hardball negotiations with the company.

title.children: Albanese 'concerned' by reports of Chinese ban on BHP iron ore imports

image.altText: New houses sit on a hillside in a housing estate at Albion Park.

props.synopsis: The revamped scheme has come into effect, with first home buyers of all income levels now able to purchase a property with only a 5 per cent deposit. Here are all the changes explained.

title.children: Sweeping changes to the first home buyer scheme explained

image.altText: Two rugby league players stand around a trophy

props.synopsis: The Roosters and Broncos have both dominated the NRLW, but the winners this weekend can legitimately stamp themselves as the pre-eminent club in the competition.

title.children: Why the NRLW 2025 grand final looms as a defining moment

image.altText: A person holding a smartphone dialling 000

props.synopsis: The Optus outage prompted serious discussions about the reliability of Australia's emergency services network. Here's how it should be operating.

title.children: How is the triple-0 network supposed to work?

image.altText: A surfer balancing on a board on a wave.

props.synopsis: The disastrous algal bloom that has been, for at least six months, lapping at South Australia's shores has turned a coastline into a frontline. It's left many swimmers, surfers and seaside business operators wondering what the upcoming summer will look like.

title.children: The sea is sick and has entered uncharted waters

image.altText: Skid marks and upturned dirt on a grassy plain.

props.synopsis: Members of the Aboriginal community are reeling after vandals allegedly performed donuts at Wybalenna on Flinders Island.

title.children: Vandalism at sacred Aboriginal site 'devastating' and 'painful'

image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: The prison guards' union and a criminal lawyer say a government "delay" in building a separate women's prison in Alice Springs is increasing overcrowding and leaving female inmates too close to male prisoners.

title.children: Women at risk from male inmates in crowded prison, advocates say

image.altText: A man with a grey beard and black cap and a blonde woman resting her hand on his shoulder smile in a radio studio.

props.synopsis: A months-long investigation by the Australian Communications and Media Authority finds seven breaches of decency rules between August and December last year.

title.children: Watchdog threatens radio network over 'vulgar' Kyle and Jackie O Show

image.altText: Light shines on rubble of a shrine damaged in an earthquake.

props.synopsis: The quake, which struck the central Cebu province, injured many others and sent residents scrambling out of their homes and into the darkness as the intense shaking cut off power.

title.children: At least 69 dead after powerful Philippines quake

image.altText: Keith Urban and Nicole Kidman smiling for the cameras

props.synopsis: The recent split of much-loved Aussie couple Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban has left the world in shock. Here's a look back on their nearly two-decade relationship.

title.children: 'She's the one': A look back at Kidman and Urban's relationship after separation

image.altText: A firefighter battles a bushfire at night.

props.synopsis: An area of southern Queensland larger than Tasmania is under a total fire ban that will be extended from central Queensland to the Gold Coast from Thursday.

title.children: Total fire ban in place for massive area of Queensland

image.altText: A wide shot of iron ore being loaded onto a ship in Port Hedland.

props.synopsis: Local share markets closed flat after trading in negative territory for most of the day. Mining giant BHP shares slipped, following reports China's state iron ore buyer slapped a temporary ban on iron ore imports from the company.

title.children: Local markets close flat, BHP shares slide as miner tight-lipped on ban reports — as it happened

image.altText: Drone Main

props.synopsis: Police allege the the man was trying to deliver drugs, nicotine patches, USB sticks and a smart watch to prisoners inside a Canberra jail.

title.children: Young father caught allegedly flying drone into Canberra prison to drop drugs

image.altText: A large brown bear stands in the river below a waterfall.

props.synopsis: A hunky brown bear named 32 Chunk has waddled away with the Fat Bear Week title for 2025.

title.children: Fat Bear Week title awarded to male who overcame potentially fatal injury

image.altText: Ningali Lawford-Wolf and Michael Caton look at each other on a couch in a still from the film Last Cab to Darwin.

props.synopsis: The director of Last Cab to Darwin — which explores the subject of voluntary assisted dying — wants all terminally ill Australians to be afforded access to dignified end-of-life care.

title.children: Last Cab to Darwin's story on VAD hits home for director on 10 year anniversary

image.altText: Michael Cheika looks to his left during a English Premiership rugby match.

props.synopsis: In a switch between the rugby codes, former Wallabies coach Michael Cheika takes another step towards an NRL head coaching role.

title.children: Ex-Wallabies coach accepts full-time role with NRL club

image.altText: Equipment begins clearing a burnt out building

props.synopsis: Demolition works begin at the Morley Market in Perth's north-eastern suburbs, a month after small businesses were destroyed in a fire at the complex.

title.children: Demolition of Morley Market underway after devastating fire

image.altText: A profile shot of a squinting older man holding a sandwich before his mouth.

props.synopsis: WA Police say the search for Mark Sear has been scaled back pending further information.

title.children: Search for missing 62-year-old man scaled back in WA's far north

image.altText: Court sketch of accused truck driver Brett Michael Russell

props.synopsis: Brett Michael Russell was driving a truck that hit a school bus north-west of Melbourne in 2022, leaving some students and staff with life-changing injuries.

title.children: Truck driver who hit school bus knew he had faulty brakes, court told

image.altText: A woman holds a glass wine bottle and aluminum bottle side by side

props.synopsis: A Victorian company releases Australia's first aluminium wine bottles to reduce its carbon footprint, while acknowledging drinkers may take some convincing.

title.children: Winery behind first aluminium wine bottle says it has no impact on taste

image.altText: A man with brown hair smiling, he is wearing a blue hat and grey shirt and is in the woods

props.synopsis: Two fellow prisoners, who were charged over the 2022 alleged murder and extortion of Benn Schinkel, will stand trial in the Supreme Court in Brisbane over his death.

title.children: Former prisoners committed to stand trial over alleged extortion, murder of inmate

image.altText: A bushy waterway leading to a dam, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: More than 53 hectares of bushland and riverine habitat will be cleared for a major upgrade to a regional Queensland dam, prompting environmentalists to raise concerns about protected lungfish and turtles.

title.children: Paradise Dam construction progresses amid environmental concerns

image.altText: A close-up of Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: This year's Boyer Lectures will consider whether our democratic system will hold in the face of global headwinds.

title.children: Will Australia's democracy survive global collapse?

image.altText: A close up of a middle aged woman with a worried expression, looking up and to her left.

props.synopsis: With Hamas yet to provide its response to Donald Trump's peace plan, affected civilians on both sides of the war share their concerns and hopes for the future.

title.children: Israeli hostage families and Palestinians in nervous wait over Gaza peace plan

image.altText: Ambulances parked outside the Royal Perth Hospital emergency department.

props.synopsis: More aged care beds, a bolstered workforce and streamlined patient care are needed to tackle ambulance ramping in Western Australia, the health sector’s unions say.

title.children: 'Nothing is working': WA ambulance ramping reaches record levels

image.altText: A large brown coloured factory positioned on a river with the view of a mountain behind it.

props.synopsis: Hobart suburbs bordering a zinc smelter and a mining town in north-west Tasmania will undergo human health risk monitoring for lead deposit rates, the state's environment protection watchdog has announced.

title.children: 'Extensive' lead monitoring to begin in Hobart residential areas near industrial sites

image.altText: A laughing girl holds a nasal flu vaccination on her mother's lap.

props.synopsis: A new jab-free flu vaccination aimed at children frightened of needles is being rolled out across Wrestern Australia in a bid to boost child vaccination rates after one of the worst flu seasons on record.

title.children: Kids scared of needles can soon get a flu vaccination via nasal spray
